ul.li: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

div.p:
Senior engineer developing new GNSS measurement related algorithms and software on iOS and WatchOS. Analyze and improve upon GNSS receiver performance at the measurement level, and work cross-functionally to improve the location experience for our customers.
Shape the next generation of location-aware mobile experiences by working on state-of-the-art technologies to seamlessly integrate peopleâ€™s digital and physical lives. If you're passionate about building technology that will make a difference, we may be the team for you.

ul.li: Strong software development experiences and excellence in C++
Significant experience and knowledge in software design paradigms and software development best practices
Experience and knowledge in signal processing techniques for GNSS - code/carrier tracking, C/N0 estimation, acquisition and peak estimation
Experience in the construction and use of GNSS observables - code phase, Doppler from code and carrier tracking, carrier phase tracking, navigation bit decoding
Experience working with signals from GNSS constellations - GPS (L1/L5), Galileo (E1/E5), Glonass, Beidou
Experience with the effects of mobile device oscillators on GNSS measurements
Familiarity with satellite orbital models used in GNSS positioning
Familiarity with PVT estimation techniques and their impact on measurement tracking and acquisition
Familiarity with positioning assistance data available on connected mobile devices - extended ephemeris, position aiding, time aiding
Knows how to debug complex systems
A passion for building things, programming, and would do it anyway even if not for work
iOS, OS X, application, and/or unix system development a plus

div.p:
Join a team which designs, implements, and powers brand new technologies and services on the world's fastest-growing mobile development platform. We are looking for a highly motivated Software Engineer with a strong background in GNSS signal processing and passion for software development, algorithms, and new technologies.
Invent and design systems to solve interesting problems in GNSS, WiFi/Cell based location services, indoor positioning, iBeacon, location based reminders, inertial sensor fusion, dead-reckoning, crowd-sourced analytics, and other location related technologies.
Minimum requirements: MS or PhD in relevant field and at least 8 years of equivalent experience.

Interested in creating new technologies and solving the algorithmic challenges that come with it. Desire to be exposed to all aspects of development; prototyping, planning, designing, productizing, launching, and scaling. Thrive in a collaborative environment and communicate effectively. Obsessively passionate and inquisitive, and seek to solve everyday problems in innovative ways. Laser-focused on the smallest details that are meaningful to our customers.
